climbs.name: Moments in Peace
climbs.fa: FA p1 & 2: Patrick Purcell & Edek Falkowski; FA p3 on TR: Patrick  Purcell; FFA p3: Jon Clark and Edek Falkowski

content.description: The third pitch is outstanding. You will have to navigate a section of loose rock on pitch 2 to reach it.P1-Climb up, clip the bolt, then move right into a slot. Stem up the slot (thin pro) and exit right to a bolted belay. 5.9 PGP2-There is a section of poor rock in the corner, so it's best to treat this pitch as R despite plenty of gear options. Undercling a flake out left to a stance. Climb a left facing corner (careful, loose) and eventually move left to better rock and another stance (optional belay). Clip a bolt out right then climb up to a comfortable belay ledge. 5.10a PG/RP3-From the belay move left and mantle to a stance beneath the crack. Jam tips and layback to a good hold. Continue up the sustained crack to an anchor; steep, pumpy, and awesome.Rap with a single 70m rope.
content.protection: Gear to 2.5" with an emphasis on tips and finger sized cams
content.location: Upon reaching the Buttress, walk uphill and left to a clearing 100 feet below the base of a large gully. Look for a bolt 8 feet up to the left of a shallow, left facing corner.

content.description: A beautiful, sustained crack in an amazing location. Climb the thin crack with multiple crux sections to an anchor.
content.protection: Thin to finger sized cams, wires, 2.5" cam useful
content.location: From where the approach trail meets the cliff, head uphill until you reach a clearing about 120 feet below the base of a large gully. Traverse out on a ledge with a cedar tree and ascend a 4th class gully (fixed line) to a ledge. Ascend another line (short pitch is possible here) and traverse left to an anchor at the base of the crack.

content.description: The Ausable Buttress lies to the east of Moss Cliff and currently has three high quality routes.
